examples.text: We decided to order a <w>jumbo</w> pizza because we were expecting a lot of guests.
The supermarket sells <w>jumbo</w> packs of detergent that last for several months.

senses.sense_definition: A large airplane, such as those used for intercontinental travel.

examples.text: The passengers boarded the <w>jumbo</w> and prepared for the long flight across the ocean.
Flying on a <w>jumbo</w> jet is often smoother than flying on smaller aircraft.

senses.sense_definition: An especially large or powerful person, animal, or thing.

examples.text: That pumpkin is a real <w>jumbo</w>, weighing more than any other in the competition.
He is a <w>jumbo</w> of a man who towers over everyone else in the room.

senses.sense_definition: A platform-mounted machine for drilling rock.

examples.text: The miners moved the <w>jumbo</w> into position to begin excavating the new tunnel.
Operating a drilling <w>jumbo</w> requires specialized training and strict safety protocols.
Astronomers recently identified a <w>jumbo</w> floating freely within the distant nebula.
The discovery of a <w>jumbo</w> challenges our current understanding of how planetary bodies form.

senses.sense_definition: A traditional animal name for an elephant.

examples.text: The children were delighted to see the elephant named <w>Jumbo</w> at the city zoo.
In the story, <w>Jumbo</w> uses his trunk to help the other animals in the forest.
